page.topic: Create a new Alpha Anywhere Workspace
page.description: Every Alpha Anywhere application begins with a Workspace. Learn how to create a new workspace for a mobile or web application by following this step-by-step guide.

figure.title: A new, blank Alpha Anywhere workspace.

section.description: To create a new mobile application with Alpha Anywhere, you must create a new workspace. A workspace contains all of the files that your application needs, including files such as components, javascript libraries, images, HTML or .a5w pages, or css stylesheets. Let's create a new, blank Alpha Anywhere workspace.

step.description: Launch Alpha Anywhere. Under the *[ui:File]* menu, select *[ui:New Workspace...]* to create a new Alpha Anywhere project.

figure.title: Create a New Workspace from the File menu.

step.description: Create a new directory. This directory is where you will save your project. Give the directory a name that will make sense for the project you are building.

figure.title: Create a new directory where your workspace will be saved.

step.description: Navigate inside the directory you created. In the *[ui:File name:]* text box, type in the same name you gave the directory. A good naming convention for Alpha Anywhere projects is to give the workspace the same name as its parent directory. Click the *[ui:Save]* button to create your new workspace.

When the *[ui:Startup Control Panel]* appears, check the box for *[ui:Open the Web Control Panel when this Workspace is opened]* if you plan to use this workspace to create a Web or Mobile application. The Web Control Panel is where all of the resources for a web or mobile application are listed. Click *[ui:OK]* to finish creating your new workspace.

figure.title: Specifying the Web Control Panel should be opened when the Workspace is opened.

section.description: Now that you have created a workspace, you can start building your application.

figure.title: A new, blank Alpha Anywhere workspace.
